gcci.text: With H100s averaging $3.39/hr, prices have corrected from 2024 peaks but remain elevated as hyperscalers hoard supply, squeezing downstream availability and forcing smaller buyers into longer lead times and higher capex commitments.

gtpi.text: At $1.25 per 1M input tokens, API price wars are compressing margins while efficiency-focused model competition drives aggressive context window expansion and faster inference, keeping total cost of ownership trending down even as usage scales.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load for AI workloads adds sustained baseload to grids that are already tight, shifting capacity planning toward fast-response generation and transmission upgrades while raising carbon footprint concerns unless paired with clean firm power.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment remains buoyant on AI adoption, yet sustainability hinges on cost discipline and clean power access; the next phase will reward players who translate price compression and efficiency gains into durable margins.
